compliancePoliciesGrossUpRelated.expense_type: Office supplies, Software, Equipment, Utilities, Professional services
compliancePoliciesGrossUpRelated.gross_up_rule: Business expenses related to workers completing their job are usually tax exempt. Expenses which are business related e.g. laptops, office supplies, etc. will be tax free providing sufficient proof is included
Other expenses are subject to varying tax rules. All approved expenses will be paid as NET to the employee and grossed up if they are not tax free
Smaller business expenses tax-free can be reimbursed against receipts (e.g. expenses that occur during a business trip) of a maximum of CHF 20 - amounts above this limit may be subject to tax
Mileage reimbursed according to official rates set by government - tax-free when following official mileage rates
Domestic and International: Breakfast CHF 15.00, Lunch CHF 35.00, Dinner CHF 40.00 tax-free. Any portion of per diem amount that exceeds the set rate will be taxable and must have a receipt provided
Overnight expenses such as hotels and transport should be reimbursed as expenses against receipts and invoices - all approved expenses will be paid as NET to employee and grossed up if not tax free
Other expenses are subject to varying tax rules. All approved expenses will be paid as NET to the employee and grossed up if they are not tax free
